content: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?> <?xml-stylesheet href="http://www.w3.org/2000/08/w3c-synd/style.css"     type="text/css"?><rdf:RDF xmlns:dc="http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/"          xmlns:rdf="http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#"          xmlns="http://purl.org/rss/1.0/">    <channel rdf:about="http://www.w3.org/Press/press.rss">       <title>W3C Press Releases</title>       <description>Latest Press Releases of the World Wide Web         Consortium. (Usually published in English, French, and         Japanese, and often translated to other languages like         Spanish, German, Chinese, or Korean.)</description>       <link>http://www.w3.org/Press/</link>       <dc:date/>       <items>          <rdf:Seq>             <rdf:li rdf:resource="http://www.w3.org/Press/#html5-cr"/>             <rdf:li rdf:resource="http://www.w3.org/Press/#tpwg-chair"/>             <rdf:li rdf:resource="http://www.w3.org/Press/#wcag2pas"/>             <rdf:li rdf:resource="http://www.w3.org/Press/#webplatform"/>             <rdf:li rdf:resource="http://www.w3.org/Press/#openstand"/>             <rdf:li rdf:resource="http://www.w3.org/Press/#signage"/>          </rdf:Seq>       </items>    </channel>    <item rdf:about="http://www.w3.org/2012/12/html5-cr.html.en">       <title> HTML5 Definition Complete, W3C Moves to Interoperability Testing and Performance </title>       <description>17 December 2012 \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd The World Wide Web Consortium (W3C) published today the complete definition of the HTML5 and Canvas 2D specifications. Though not yet W3C standards, these specifications are now feature complete, meaning businesses and developers have a stable target for implementation and planning. HTML5 is the cornerstone of the Open Web Platform, a full programming environment for cross-platform applications with access to device capabilities; video and animations; graphics; style, typography, and other tools for digital publishing; extensive network capabilities; and more. (...)    </description>       <link>http://www.w3.org/2012/12/html5-cr.html.en</link>       <dc:date>2012-12-17T00:00:00Z</dc:date>    </item>    <item rdf:about="http://www.w3.org/2012/11/tpwg-chair-pr.html">       <title> W3C Announces Peter Swire as new Co-Chair for Do Not Track Standard </title>       <description>28 November 2012 \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd Today the World Wide Web Consortium (W3C) announces the appointment of Peter Swire as co-Chair of the Tracking Protection Working Group. The group is working to define the Do Not Track protocol, and to establish agreement about what compliance with the Do Not Track signal will mean in practice. A law professor at the Ohio State University and veteran of the Clinton and Obama administrations (in the US), Swire brings significant experience in consensus-building and broad expertise on privacy matters to the table. (...)    </description>       <link>http://www.w3.org/2012/11/tpwg-chair-pr.html</link>       <dc:date>2012-11-28T00:00:00Z</dc:date>    </item>    <item rdf:about="http://www.w3.org/2012/07/wcag2pas-pr.html">       <title> W3C Web Content Accessibility Guidelines 2.0 Approved as ISO/IEC International Standard </title>       <description>15 October 2012 \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd Today the World Wide Web Consortium (W3C) and the Joint Technical Committee JTC 1, Information Technology of the International Organization for Standardization (ISO) and the International Electrotechnical Commission (IEC), announced approval of the Web Content Accessibility Guidelines (WCAG) 2.0 as an ISO/IEC International Standard (ISO/IEC 40500:2012). (...)    </description>       <link>http://www.w3.org/2012/07/wcag2pas-pr.html</link>       <dc:date>2012-10-15T00:00:00Z</dc:date>    </item>    <item rdf:about="http://www.w3.org/2012/10/webplatform.html.en">       <title> Announcing Web Platform Docs </title>       <description>http://www.w3.org/ \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd8 October 2012\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd W3C, in collaboration with Adobe, Facebook, Google, HP, Microsoft, Mozilla, Nokia, Opera, and others, announces today the alpha release of Web Platform Docs (docs.webplatform.org).This is a new community-driven site that aims to become a comprehensive and authoritative source for web developer documentation. (...)    </description>       <link>http://www.w3.org/2012/10/webplatform.html.en</link>       <dc:date>2012-10-08T00:00:00Z</dc:date>    </item>    <item rdf:about="http://www.w3.org/2012/08/openstand.html.en">       <title> Leading Global Standards Organizations Endorse \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdOpenStand\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd Principles that Drive Innovation and Borderless Commerce </title>       <description>PISCATAWAY, N.J., and WASHINGTON, D.C., United States; GENEVA, Switzerland, and http://www.w3.org/ \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd29 August 2012\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdFive leading global organizations\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdIEEE, Internet Architecture Board (IAB), Internet Engineering Task Force (IETF), Internet Society and World Wide Web Consortium (W3C)\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdtoday announced that they have signed a statement affirming the importance of a jointly developed set of principles establishing a modern paradigm for global, open standards. The shared \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdOpenStand\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd principles\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdbased on the effective and efficient standardization processes that have made the Internet and Web the premiere platforms for innovation and borderless commerce\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdare proven in their ability to foster competition and cooperation, support innovation and interoperability and drive market success. (...)    </description>       <link>http://www.w3.org/2012/08/openstand.html.en</link>       <dc:date>2012-08-29T00:00:00Z</dc:date>    </item>    <item rdf:about="http://www.w3.org/2012/07/signage.html.en">       <title> W3C Identifies how the Web will Transform the Digital Signage Industry </title>       <description>http://www.w3.org/ \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd 18 July 2012\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd W3C announced today new momentum for making the Web the future interoperable platform for Digital Signage. W3C issued a summary of key topics and use cases for bringing Digital Signage to the Web, as well as a first gap analysis of enhancements to the Web to enable the transformation of the Digital Signage ecosystem. (...)    </description>       <link>http://www.w3.org/2012/07/signage.html.en</link>       <dc:date>2012-07-18T00:00:00Z</dc:date>    </item> </rdf:RDF>
